text: Now clean for three days, Bubbles receives stark advice and learns about HIV transmission from his NA mentor, Walon.
Avon and Stringer instruct Wee-Bey to initiate contact with Omar Little to propose a fake truce negotiation.
Stringer Bell successfully persuades Avon Barksdale to further insulate himself by giving up his personal pager, forcing communication through Stringer.
McNulty observes Judge Phelan appears hesitant and less supportive of the Barksdale investigation.
ASA Pearlman confirms McNulty's suspicion, informing him that Judge Phelan has been dropped from the mayor's re-election ticket, likely due to the controversial case.
D'Angelo Barksdale dismisses his girlfriend Donette's domestic plans and refuses her request for money, showing growing detachment.
D'Angelo attempts to reconcile with Shardene outside Orlando's, but she refuses to speak with him following her cooperation with police.
Detective Freamon pinpoints the Barksdale organization's main stash resupply trigger to calls made from a specific payphone in the Pimlico area.
With Herc unavailable, Detectives Carver and Sydnor are assigned surveillance duty on the crucial Pimlico payphone.
Detective Santangelo identifies low-level dealer Little Man using a tower payphone linked to the resupply chain.
Sydnor observes the individual receiving calls at the Pimlico payphone and identifies the Barksdale's primary resupply courier.
Freamon directs Sydnor to follow the resupply courier, leading them to identify a suburban house as the main Barksdale stash location.
Freamon, Sydnor, and Prez conduct surveillance on the main stash house disguised as municipal sanitation workers.
Orlando, the strip club manager, is arrested by unrelated narcotics officers (including Troy Wiggins) while attempting to buy cocaine from an undercover.
Attempting to leverage his way out of the charge, Orlando gives the arresting officers Avon Barksdale's name, triggering the detail's involvement.
In county jail, Orlando is recognized by Marvin Browning, a Barksdale associate, who informs the organization of Orlando's arrest and cooperation attempt.
Barksdale lawyer Maurice Levy visits Orlando in jail, not to help, but solely to remove Orlando's name from the club's liquor license, officially severing ties.
Lt. Daniels proposes using the arrested Orlando as bait in a controlled buy-bust operation to target higher-level Barksdale members.
Despite Daniels arguing to wait for better intelligence from the wiretap, Dep. Comm. Burrell and Major Foerster mandate an immediate buy-bust using Orlando.
McNulty bribes patrol officers with food and beer to stake out Wallace's known squatting location.
Detective Greggs informs McNulty that Omar Little has reached out, needing medical attention for the shoulder wound sustained during the shootout with Wee-Bey.
Wallace provides a detailed statement to the police, implicating Stringer Bell, Wee-Bey Brice, and others in the torture and murder of Brandon.
Due to lack of funding for formal witness protection, Daniels and Pearlman arrange to relocate Wallace to live with his grandmother on the rural Eastern Shore.
Noticing Wallace suffering from heroin withdrawal symptoms, Lt. Daniels personally drives him to his grandmother's house on the Eastern Shore.
McNulty faces an emergency court hearing initiated by his ex-wife Elena seeking to restrict his child visitation rights.
The judge dismisses Elena's formal request, urging McNulty and Elena to resolve their visitation issues privately.
When McNulty pleads his case to Elena, she reveals she possesses photographic evidence of his affair with ASA Rhonda Pearlman.
While socializing, Detective Greggs recounts a story of a thrilling arrest, highlighting the adrenaline rush of police work.
Greggs' partner Cheryl appears visibly uncomfortable with the intensity of the story, but Greggs acknowledges her feelings, leading to reconciliation.
Omar Little meets with Stringer Bell, under Proposition Joe's supervision, to discuss the proposed truce; Omar secretly wears a police wire.
The wired meeting yields little incriminating evidence; Stringer carefully avoids implicating Avon directly in Brandon's murder.
Omar deduces the truce offer is a setup when Stringer doesn't immediately reject his demand for $5,000 in compensation.
Realizing the danger, Omar abandons the meeting and immediately leaves Baltimore, boarding a bus bound for New York City.
McNulty witnesses Omar's departure from Baltimore and asks him to maintain contact.
Avon, Stringer, and Wee-Bey discuss the failed attempt to trap Omar during the truce meeting.
Shardene, now cooperating with police, attempts to listen in on the Barksdale leadership's conversation but gathers little useful intelligence.
Bubbles, committed to staying clean, asks Detective Greggs for financial help securing a place to live away from temptation; she promises to give him money the next day.
Forced by superiors, Lt. Daniels organizes the risky buy-bust operation targeting the Barksdales using Orlando as bait.
Detective Kima Greggs goes undercover, posing as Orlando's girlfriend during the buy-bust operation.
Barksdale soldier Savino meets with Orlando and Greggs, directing them to drive to a secondary, secluded location for the supposed drug deal.
The buy-bust operation goes disastrously wrong when Savino suddenly abandons the vehicle, and hidden Barksdale gunmen ambush the car.
Orlando is killed instantly in the ambush.
Detective Kima Greggs is critically wounded during the ambush, suffering gunshot wounds to her neck and chest.
